description: I installed the game but it can't open. It's okay, i said to myself to i can remove it, but it can't too @_@

I remember Quake from the old days. I thought I might take a trip down memory lane. After install I was prompted to run 'game-data-packager -i quake ...' Unfortunately, there is no game-data-packager. Sigh...

Go here..
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/eoan/+source/game-data-packager
summary: Where to download Game data packager

description: I can't launch the game because some data is missing.
summary: Not that good, I wold advise not to install it

description: Hey! I see the link that you posted Bob, but were is the download.

Received the error about data files missing. Ran the following:

sudo apt-get install innoextract lhasa
game-data-packager -i quake
i used to play it on my old macintosh but now when i installed it on my new lenovo thinkpad its game data is apparently missing? even though i was up all night installing its data it DOES NOT LAUNCH.
Need to "download" other stuff. Why put up a game for download if it doesn't download the game? Garbage.
Cmmon guys. You just have to download the game data packager and then run it. It works perfectly. There are some reviews here that explain it step by step

Seriously. All those that wrote that they could not find the Game Data Packager... did you look to see how to install it? Did you click on the link for Website above?

Jude Ulibarri posted exactly how to install it.

It is as basic as Linux gets...Click the install button. when done, run the 2 lines Jude was kind enough to repost in here, and then type Quake. If installed in under 2 minutes and I was in game and reliving memories past.

Jude - thank you for your post, it might have taken me an extra 5 minutes to find that without your help :-)

Follow the instructions given below re: installation of the Game Data Packager. Installs quickly and effortlessly.
Works well in Ubuntu 20.04.
Game is a little dated now (obviously) but still great fun and entertaining. A real game changer - excuse the pun - in its day.

if you are having expansion troubles ep5 or 6 enter

sudo apt install unar
summary: I know how to get expansions

summary: best source port here/better then quakespasm on ubuntu

description: It will not run no matter what I try, what's the deal. It is pure bullcrap.

1st step - install
2bd step - sudo apt-get install innoextract lhasa
3rd step - game-data-packager -i quake
after 3rd... next step - Launch
and play for fun!=)

Haven't found any bugs yet!
To install the game-data-packager package, run
sudo apt install game-data-packager
in a terminal
then now you can run the commands
then if it tells you 'innoextract' and 'lha' are required/not found when you run the commands to install Quake data files, run:
sudo apt install innoextract
sudo apt install lhasa
in a terminal

I pushed play and no rection,

Sorry for distrubing.

The installation process isn't as bad as some people say it is, BUT
It's the short version of the game, meaning that after completing the first chapter you can't have access to all the others. Quite annoying, esp knowing you can't even use your old save, and you'd have to go throught the first chapter again. Is there a full version of the game anywhere?

summary: Este juego se puede arrancar sin problemas con WINE,

description:
Funciona bastante bien.
Lo estoy probando en un Linux virtualizado.
Los niveles se instalan aparte.

Para que funcione en la terminal poner:
sudo apt-get install quake
enter
sudo mkdir usr/share/games/quake/id1
enter
cd usr/share/games/quake/id1
ener
sudo wget -c -t0 http://www.mirafiori.com/ftp/pub/gaming/pak0.pak http://www.mirafiori.com/ftp/pub/gaming/pak1.pak
enter
quake
enter
https://misjuegosenlinux.blogspot.com/2020/05/quake-1-en-ubuntu-2004.html
